Rule.NonCompliantComment: Database accounts are configured with more privileges than necessary, increasing security risks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure least privilege for database accounts. Manually review each account's permissions and remove unnecessary privileges. Use the following command to list user roles: mongo --eval "db.getSiblingDB('admin').runCommand({ usersInfo: 1 })";

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Role-based access control (RBAC) is not enabled or not configured properly, which may allow unauthorized actions.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure that role-based access control is enabled and configured appropriately. Manually review roles and permissions using the following command: mongo --eval "db.getSiblingDB('admin').getRoles({ showPrivileges: true })";

Rule.NonCompliantComment: MongoDB is running using a privileged or shared service account, which may allow unauthorized access or privilege escalation.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure that MongoDB is run using a non-privileged, dedicated service account. Manually configure the MongoDB service to use a dedicated, unprivileged user. Command: sudo useradd -r -s /bin/false mongodb; sudo chown -R mongodb:mongodb /var/lib/mongodb;

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Roles for MongoDB databases are not properly defined or are overly permissive.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure that each role for each MongoDB database is necessary and grants only the required privileges. Use the following command to list database roles: mongo --eval "db.getSiblingDB('admin').getRoles({ showPrivileges: true })";

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Superuser or admin roles are not regularly reviewed, which may allow unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Regularly review Superuser/Admin roles and their assigned privileges. Use the following command: mongo --eval "db.getSiblingDB('admin').getUsers({ showCredentials: false })";
